meanings.definition: To swoop down suddenly and grasp or seize eagerly.
meanings.sent1: The cat will pounce on the toy mouse.
meanings.sent2: The tiger will pounce on its prey in the jungle.
meanings.sent3: I saw the squirrel pounce on the acorn with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The opportunity to pounce on the sale was too good to resist.
meanings.sent5: The child watched the frog pounce on the bug with wide eyes.

meanings.sent1: The cheetah's pounce was swift and graceful.
meanings.sent2: The surprise pounce from the cat made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent3: The ninja's pounce was so quiet, it startled his friend.
meanings.sent4: The pounce of the basketball player towards the hoop was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The sudden pounce of the spider caught me off guard.
